values: I feel incredibly sorry for all of those young teenagers today.  What a horrible time to be searching for yourself.  So much time spent perfecting makeup and hair and acessories.  When they're older they're really going to wish they hadn't wasted so much time on silly things.  It must be so hard to try to live up to one singular image.  They should try worshipping themselves the way they were before they discovered Paris Hilton.  Before they begged mom and daddy for little yapping dog and clothes worth more than some people's cars, just so they could be accepted by their "friends".  Man, i'm really glad i was born in the eighties.  aren't you?

I'm back for good! i got a fancy new laptop and i'm moving to LA in august and my life is starting and i'm so excited!

Jesus, daddy and ghostie! My Chemical fucking romance is coming to Voodoo!!!! I can't believe it, i am so fucking excited! Trish and I are going to see them, and I am going to marry Gerard and it will be amazing! God I love rockstars!

I GOT THE PART! I GOT THE PART! I GOT THE PART! I got the part of Leah in Beautiful Thing at the Marigny Theatre! I'm so excited!!!! see taylor? you were right! good things were coming my way!!!

I'm so fucking tired. i just took my mom to work, and now i can't go back to sleep. it's 9:46 in the am! i'm not supposed to be up this early ever. 
i think i'm losing weight. sweet. of course with my luck all i'll lose will be my boobs. fuck. 
leland's coming to the show tonight, and so is teddy and britt and britt's gf who i FINALLY get to meet. i think alisha is coming too with jenni, and lauren might be coming with someone. i have a lot of people to do well for tonight. i wish i didn't know, i always do better for strangers. i have a bad feeling about tonight. i just know my skirt is going to fall off or i'm going to just crack up laughing onstage. thanks to brittain we have a 5:30 call instead of 6:30 because we have a set change run. godammit! how hard is it to move a motherfucking styrofoam wall? twice! ugh, whatever. gary was so pissed he left at intermission. he came backstage yelling, "who the fuck was it?" my name is definetly on the change list for that one, but i have never ever done it, so i better not get blamed for it. 
80's night tonight! woowoo! i'm going to leave my makeup on for it. my makeup is freaking pimp!! i would wear it like that every day, but the blue kind of stains my face. i'm so hungry, but if i eat anything i'll throw up. mrrrrrrrr
http://asparaturtle.livejournal.com/36798.html

oh god. i just heard from evida that there is a pocahontas movie coming out with real people. I AM SO EXCITED!!! oh my god i can't believe it! i can't wait! evida, we haaave to go see it!

i just fucking got back from changeover. it's 3:14 in the am. that's fucking rediculous. that was the longest changover ever! i think bk went crosseyed...

I'm really tired. today was day 1 of being a street performer! liz and I made $14 in an hour! if we keep this up, we'll be rich! it's hard though, all that standing and singing...hahaha! i'm hungry too. there's never any food in this house.
http://asparaturtle.livejournal.com/36141.html

taylor's right, david cuthbert is a complete asshole. he said othello was wonderful except it was like a soap opera and with tony's new haircut and andrea's beauty, it should be called "the bald and the beautiful"! what the fuck? and when tony played hamlet years ago, he said tony was too overweight to play that part! first of all, what does tony's haircut or his weight have to do with the play? second of all, tony's sooooo handsome, and his acting waaaaaaaay overshadows any physical flaws he may have. david cuthbert is an asshole, and next time i see him, i'm going to give him a piece of my mind. sure, sure freedom of the press, well i get freedom of speech and i can tell that bastard off for being a bad writer and insulting tony for no reason.

anyway, i'm in love! i admitted it today. walking on air? a rosy view of the world? i think not, my friends. i think not.

my medacine has coedine in it. weeeee!

i'm at sft backstage doing crew for othello, bitches! i'm really, really bored. and i'm still sick. yeah, zithromax may work for some people, but i feel pretty much the same. 

ok bye, i have to move things...

just so everyone knows, my new picture is of the beautiful and incredibly talented jason schwartzman, not some silly emo whiner. 
i went to the doctor today and told them i needed to get better asap. she gave me what's called a "Zpack". two shots, one's a steroid, the other, god knows what, and two prescriptions, one for a 3-day antibiotic called zithromax, and one for a cough syrup with coedine in it. i didn't get the second one. 
i feel about the same. 
i watched i heart huckabees. yesterday i watched beyond the sea, and the day before i watched the girl next door. they were all really good. jude law does a terrible american accent in huckabees. ah well. 
ben's moving to l.a. so help me god if he becomes famous before i do.
http://asparaturtle.livejournal.com/35096.html

i saw batman, it was fucking AWESOME!!!!! one of the best action movies of all time. i saw fantastic 4, it was really good, but a little anticlimactic. i saw bewitched, which was cute, you know, a nice, funny, romantic comedy. i saw mad-hot ballroom, which was awesome. who knew a 6th grade ballroom dancing competition could be so compelling? and today i saw charlie and the chocolate factory. it was, i'm sorry to say, quite disappointing. i love johnny depp and tim burton to pieces, but this was much less than i expected. nothing made me go, "Oh my god, that's awesome!" but then, nothing made me say, "wow, that's the stupidest thing i've ever seen!" it was just, so-so. i cannot wait for the penguin documentary, and the new tim burton, Corpse Bride looks really good. and then fall movies!! i love fall movies!! they're the best! 
so i guess it's obvious nothing exciting happened today. oh, i went on the kirschman's new boat. wow. that thing is nice. i mean...really nice. damn. it's almost as long as my house. and it has a bathroom with a shower, and a master bedroom, and a kitchen, and a living room, plus a whole lot of room on top. it's really, really, really nice.  
i need drugs. oh stop shaking your head, britt! drugs for my cough.
http://asparaturtle.livejournal.com/34925.html

i just realized the clock on my lj is in 24 hour time. ah well. the show went well tonight, everything went smoothly. the masking on the bed during the street scene doesn't make any sense to me. i have to put it on the bed in full view of the audience, so why would it matter if they saw it or not, they know it's there! i have the worst cough of my life. it's horrible. today is day 2 of bad cough, and i hope it goes away soon. i'm going to see south pacific tomorrow night!! i'm so excited. i've decided i'm taking a year off before i go to college.
http://asparaturtle.livejournal.com/34647.html

my feet hurt so bad. stupid shoes. i don't think i'm cut out for crew. i'm more of a people person. brittany and i would make at least $10 each from concession tips, and now Ben and Lydia are doing it, they made $4 total. hhahaha. i fucked up today. i'll get that stupid mist thing right tomorrow. but i did the blood awesome! woowoo. ugh, lydia and ben left after intermission, so of course I had to do the ice chests at the end of the night. those kids need to get it straight. whitney is a control freak. but she's a good person. she just needs to let people do things themselves and wait for them to ask for help instead of just interjection her opinion all the time. i haven't spent a lot of time with liz lately. we've never seemed to be in the same place at the same time this summer. during merchant, she was in the show, and brittany and i were doing concessions. for othello, we're doing crew and liz is doing intern stuff. we don't have any scenes together in 2 gents, so i never see her anymore. she just called me. she probably thinks i'm mad at her or don't like her anymore. i just had a kind of left of the middle day today. not as bad as the other day though. 2 and a half weeks until 2 gents opens. i think we're in good shape. gary's awesome. i love that fool. he knows i know the secret. the first time i saw him today he stared and smiled at me as he passed by. special K told him i guessed it. he better be nice to me or i might let something slip. i really want to see west side. i can't though, because of crew. i'm playing lucetta in 2 gents, by the way. i asked gary if i could be eating cheez-itz out of my purse. he liked it. it makes sense, because my name's lu-CHEDDA. haha. this role was so type-cast. it's hilarious. anyone who sees it will know. the whole time, i'm laying on a bench eating. and all the lines are so easy because they're things i would actually say. brittany gave me one of the best compliments of my life yesterday. it was roughly as follows: 
BRITTANY: Molly, you'd be a good director, because you know how to take control, you know your shit, and you have genious ideas. 
coming from brittany, i consider that extremely flattering.
there's a woman in othello who is a horrible actor. and she takes herself so seriously offstage. it's hilarious. people who take themselves too seriously make me laugh so much. quagmire still has not said one word to any of the interns. what is UP with that guy? he takes himself a little too seriously as well, and he also sucks. really the only people who are good are tony, sean, gavin and gary. i wonder why there are so few female actors in sft. girlie-girl is really immature, and she dresses so badly. today everything she wore was different shades of blue. it matched waaaaaaaaay to well. 

ok i need to stop bitching about this stupid stuff. goodnight moon.

Cooking breakfast for the queen

Playing piano for the children of the king.

She's old enough to know better.
So cry baby cry.

ok
http://asparaturtle.livejournal.com/34177.html

today was a really bad day. i felt better when i talked to trisha though. but everything else was horrible. oh except when evan was making fun of liz when she was shit drunk last summer and was all over him. that shit was funny. 

but anyway, everything is wrong still. i thought talking about it last night would help, but it just made me feel worse. i think too much. i have that sick feeling in my stomach and that tight feeling in my chest that i get when i get crazy. whitney asked me what was wrong. she doesn't know me well enough to know that i hate that. if i need help, i'll ask for it. trust me. everything i eat tastes bad. it all makes me feel so sick. everything i see and hear makes me want to cry. daniel was telling me today about his daughter who is now 20 or 21 whom he has never met. i'm afraid i'll make mistakes like that. i'm afraid i'll fuck up my life and then before i know it, it will be gone and i won't have done anything. but seeing daniel and how happy he is, and how much he loves life after all the shit he's been through, makes me feel a lot better. the whole concept of the world and how people go through life so blind to everything except their own lives brings me to the point of tears. i can't deal with the fact that i may very well die alone. death scares me. no, regret scares me. i'm afraid of what i'll miss after i'm dead. i'm afraid of all the things i never said and did. and i'm afraid that if people i care about are gone tomorrow, they won't know how i feel. but i can't bring myself to say the things i want to say because i'm afraid of what will happen. but it's only people i care about. the people closest to me are the ones i keep the darkest secrets from. because they are the only ones who's opinions matter to me. 
and poor, poor lucy. we all care about her so much even though none of us really know her. she always brightened up any room she was in. she counteracted with the theatre people's drama. she is so sweet. i hope she gets better. please, please let lucy get better. 
why do things have to be so tragic? why do people have to die? why are some people not loved? how can people be so horrible, and shameful, and secretive, and bitter, and jealous? people are horrible, horrible things.
http://asparaturtle.livejournal.com/33819.html

so i just got back from yet another tiffin session with special K. we talked about the set and got some really good ideas. we've decided we're going to start a production company after college. man, tiffin is like a house of genious. every time we go there we get all these great ideas. and every time i go i feel so much better. if i'm having a shitty day, i call special K and we have ourselves a little tiffin fix, and all is well. it's fabulous. we started blocking today. whitney is playing julia now because lucy had to go into treatment. i know no one knows who these people are, or what i'm talking about, but it just feels good to talk about all the things that go on and not have to explain everything. we're going to try to see hamlet tomorrow, but it's probably really expensive. i told K we should usher. i will do anything if it gets me something for free. i can't wait to see it. and i can't wait to see this billy slaughter character who is apparently a huge douchebag and who taylor is supposedly obsessed with. oh taylor, i love you. i'll hopefully be in mandeville on sunday and part of monday! so i'll be calling my northshore homies! goodnight all. it looks like i will be in bed before 2 at least once this summer.
http://asparaturtle.livejournal.com/33634.html

ugh i just ate pineapple yogurt. it was good at first, but now...ugh. just like my life.
i love alisha. my evening was going so well, and then liz got mad at me and i was really sad, and then i watched a thing on pbs about dwarfs, and i was happy again, and now i might go to tiffin with taylor! weeeeeeee...for now.
http://asparaturtle.livejournal.com/33332.html

everything is foggy and stale. i need something to pick me up. something to make me feel like i can stand up all day. yeah, jokes are fun, but at some point i'm going to throw up from it all. i haven't had a meaningful conversation in months. i'm exhausted from seeing the same people every day and accomplishing so little. i wonder what i would do if the world did explode, as britt said. well i guess i'd be dead so it really woudn't matter. there's an intern who's anorexic. she looks like a skelleton. she's so thoughtful and always tries to please everyone. it's really sad. i saw the rendering for my costume for 2 gents. it's hott. rediculous, but hott all the same. liz has to wear a leather bra. sucker. noah will like it. gary left before curtain call because he wasn't getting any laughs. that's probably one of the most unprofessional things i've ever heard. but then, it's gary. he's a genious, but he's really immature and a huge hypocrite. 

j
john lost the fuzy off my earphone. he didn't look for it. he leaves his dishes everywhere. i think my parents over-compensated for him being one of the middle children. he has to be the favorite. he does favors with a smug sigh like he's a fucking angel and even though he's done all the other housework, he'll take time out and do this because he's such a fucking good person. i'm the villain when he's home. he needs to take a goddamn bath. he's making the house smell like fucking shit. treehugger

i just realized one of the reasons i'm so down lately is because i've been listening to everyone else all around me and not telling about my monsters. i couldn't quite put my finger on it, but that's it. i have to stop being up for anything and be like, "no i have to go home and get in bed before three tonight." all i hear about is noah, gary, and john. not that i mind, but it's turning into hostillity because i didn't realize before that that was the reason why i've been so black. i have no one to yack about. not that i need someone, because i don't. although, people live off of each other. people feed off of each other's energy. without the other person, there's no other energy and it gets replaced with monsters. monsters that people i love don't like. wow. revalations are fabulous. i have just as much worth talking about as they do. i think the reason i've been always listening lately is because i'm feeling not good enough. if my things aren't good enough, why should i talk about them? my things are fucking plenty good enough. 

i need to see more britt, and trisha, and the dell crew. oh i miss those boys. ok alisha, i admit it, i miss the boys.
http://asparaturtle.livejournal.com/33156.html

I've lost my fucking script. first read through and table work is friday and i've lost my fucking script. fabulous. i hate men. i hate them. i hate them. they're such losers. they do the stupidest things, and then when they're confronted about it, they have no idea what's going on. i love foster though. too bad he likes boys. brittany and i agreed that if we were lesbians we would fuck each other. well that does me a lot of good. if only men weren't such pussies. correction: boys. all the males i have come in contact with that aren't professional actors or into men, are boys. it's horrible. i might as well be a nun teaching little boys how to grow up to be strong, responsible men. except my students are all over grown assholes. oh well, i guess this is how it's going to be for a while, while i'm in that after highschool, before grown men limbo. that lesbian thing is looking pretty good.
http://asparaturtle.livejournal.com/32973.html

ok, candide. worst musical ever. of course teddy was fabulous, completely stole the show. i mean, i love that last song, but that's about it. liz and brittany fell asleep. i didn't really pay attention at all. good thing we got in for free because i would have hanged myself if i had had to pay. i fucking finally saw britt's punk-ass! that boy is like an apparition. or maybe he's just so gaddam popular he can't make time for his old friends anymore!!! 
today was two gents auditions. my monologue is so fucking short. it's 13 lines. but that really doesn't bother me because i know i hate sitting through those long-ass monologues. i guess i don't really care what part i get, but i really, really don't want a small part. granted, if i get a small part, i will be gracious and do my best, but i'm just really fucking sick of small parts. i'm also sick of foster getting small parts, but whatev. aaaaaaaaaaaanyway...alisha is going to work her magic and come visit me!!!!! i'm so excited! i have to clean my room before she comes because it's really gross. oh my god, speaking of gross. there were the most disgusting people sitting in the booth behind us at tiffin tonight. it was a man and a woman, and they seriously had some problems. maybe their mothers just didn't teach them well, but they were burping and farting up a storm. like, woooooooow.

correction: big gay brad's flaming gala. 
the gala was fabulous, lots of rum, music, smoking and laughing, not to mention the amazing food. warm brie, smoked salmon, shrimp, blue frog chocolates. so i thought sean was adorable, and last night i found out that surprise! he's gay. of course he is, i was attracted to him. the pub was utterly fabulous last night. oh-so crowded and full of oh-so gorgeous men in oh-so tiny little jeans and t-shirts. i heard through the grapevine that britain is very close to being kicked out of sft due to her overall intolerance and completely vomit-inducing fashion sense. i wonder if she's aware that just about half the theatre world population is gay. she'll never get anywhere in this business with that close-minded attitude. it's not just her attitude, but the fact that she feels she can say that to someone's face and there be no consequences. i think it's time for me to say, "No offense Britain, but I don't believe in people dressing as badly as you do."
i haven't seen my old chums in a solid week, maybe even two, i've lost all concept of time, and it's bringing me down. i need some serious time with my favorite slidell boys and madeville girls. one greek/french girl in particular!
i really need some straight boy time after being around all these fabulous men all week. and some girl who's name starts with a taylor and ends with a shurte needs to call me and the jew so she can catch up on all the sft drama!
oh and also, i've decided i hate males. except for foster of course. 
hey taylor: I had masculinity, but I ate it...

ok, i'm not going to let things that are out of my hands bother me. if people want to be bitches and complete hypocrites, so be it. ugh, gary's in idiot. aaaaaaaaanyway, i'm supposed to be on my way to pick up b to go to the show right now. tonight's the gala! big gay brad's big gay gala! woowoo! i can't wait for the rum! oh and so teddy has been chatting with me between candide rehearsals in the lupin lobby, and charlie and brad toootally think he's gay, not to mention that he has a nice ass. hahahaha

I'm back from Newellton. My grandpa has a week to live. I think I have a real problem with death. Every time it gets close to me, I run the other way and try to completely avoid it. Maybe I don't want any responsibility. I don't want the fact that I may or may not have done something or said something wrong in someone's last hours hanging over me for the rest of my life. And seeing him, laying there in bed, thin and frail and sallow was such a shock. Just a few months ago he was hilarious and full of life and stories and jokes. Now all he can do is lay in that bed, wasting away the last days of his life. He's on morphine and other things, so he's hallucinating. His eyes open in his sleep and he moves his hands like he's in his shop again, or working in the garden again. He always asks for his hands to be washed, and says they're not clean enough. He tries to put his thumbs in his pants like he used to do. He tries to chew on the toothpick that was always in his teeth. He drinks out of the tin cup that hung on the cooler in the back of his truck. He moves his hands like he's driving the tractor. His skin on his face and hands is suddenly so thin and yellow. He looks already dead. I wonder if he knows he's going to die soon. His conscious mind has died already I think. Nothing he says now is in relation to anything that is actually happening. He used to be so tall, but on that bed he looks so small. And his voice. His voice used to be deep and colorful and unmistakable, now it's wheezy and higher in pitch, like someone is strangling him. I think the thing that's making this so hard for me is the change. He's a completely different person. He used to tell me stories and talk about the war and things, now he doesn't recognize me. Soon he won't recognize his own daughter, or sons, or wife. This is the closest death has ever been to me. It doesn't make sense, and it makes me so angry. I don't know if I'll be able to handle the funeral. That sounds so selfish. Dad is losing his father, and maw-maw, her husband. I feel like I should only show a degree of sadness. I think most of the tears are just from fear. People fear things they don't understand, and this I do not understand. 
Adam's mother-in-law died saturday morning. He wasn't there with Rachel. He was crying, mom was crying. He went back to Boston that night. At least he's there for Rachel now. In my life, people always die in groups of 3. Wendy, my paw-paw, and a third. I'm waiting to see. I'm desperately hoping this time will break the routine.

Whew! Anton remembered to clean the house! That was a close one. Good thing he's responsible and all. So I had planned this toootally bitchin' weekend for me and liz and the gang, but I suddenly remembered I have to treck up to Newellton to visit my paw-paw. He has liver cancer. He has a few months to live. I realized I'm really horrible with goodbyes. Long-term goodbyes. I guess it's because I have a huge fear of regret. If I never get to see someone again, I'll be haunted with the feeling that I forgot to tell them something, or forgot to do something. It's the scariest thing I can think of. It sounds selfish, I shouldn't be thinking about how bad this is making me feel, I should be thinking about him. People in my life die in groups of 3...sometimes more...so I'm waiting to see who's next. 

I'm watching the news. It wasn't my idea, it's my mom. Is it just me, or does bad news come in floods? A highschool shooting in the midwest killed something like 11 people. A guy took his gradfather's police guns and killed his grandparents, then a teacher, a security guard, students, and himself. There was a shooting at a New Orleans school recently. The parents don't seem to care. A woman's house burned down. She was crying, she doesn't have anywhere to go. I feel really bad about Brianna. She could have died. What if she had died? What would we have done? I can't think about it. I'm going to bed. I can't go to bed. I'm going to do something else. I don't know what.

So, I'm like dying right now. I have a stomach virus. I can't eat anything because my body will expel it as soon as or before it hits my stomach, I can't even drink water, which means I will have to live with being dehydrated for days. My back and stomach are in such pain from being bent over the toilet twice every hour that I can't laugh or cough or talk a whole lot. I can't lay down because the post nasal drip that's also going on makes me even more sick when it creeps into my throat and I have a horrible headache on top of everything else. But I feel better than I did yesterday, so that's good. And I really do appreciate certain people bringing me soup, but I wasn't about to get up and use up all my energy trying to open the door and end up hugging the tiolette again. I mean, I can't even eat soup anyway. But it was really nice of cerain people to do that. I hope anton remembered to clean the house, my dad will be there sometime today...
